transcript.content: Jane's Addiction, Just Because on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. We're all here then.
Oy oy.
About five past one.
Yeah.
Got two hours to go.
I imagine you've got all kinds of treats lined up, Rick.
Well, there's lots of things on the show. Great music. You know, Nirvana, Radiohead, The Darkness to name but three.
Can I play you something from Led Zeppelin later?
Yeah, please do. And maybe some Neil Young.
Oh.
Um, now, coming up also on the show, we're continuing a thing we've started. We only got four weeks to go before maybe we either give it altogether or go away for a couple of months.
Is it four weeks or three weeks now?
Is it three weeks? Oh, I dunno.
I'm not sure.
I think it's the 16th of August, innit?
Can't end soon enough.

Well, it might be that - it'd be a shame to end it forever, but it's all up to Karl to - again, he's in a grumpy mood. We're trying to up his attitude and it's - it's them, it's the listener that counts, Karl, not us. We may be feeling bad but you, the listener, count. You come first, yeah? Okay, up, up, up. Yeah? Big. Big 'em up. Big up London. Big up you, the listener. Karl, leave yourself at home for a little while, yeah? Um, we're gonna continue that thing we started last week, we were doing the list of the most hated people in Britain. It's not us, it's the listeners. So, um, keep coming with those suggestions of people you just, uh - obviously you don't hate them. We don't want a list of mass murderers, dictators and politicians. You can have them, but uh --
Oh, um, mass murderers and politicians? What's the difference? Oh!
Good - good point.
Oh!
Good point.
Uh, satire.
Satire, yeah. No, probably that - that's - we - we do some jokes like that as well, won't we?
Satire like that?
We're trying to get onto Radio 4.
Trying to get on there, yeah.
And uh --
If there's any kind of amusing show that perhaps takes a sideways look at the week's news.

Yeah. If there are any Radio 4 producers who are - you know, have been knocking around for about 12 years with the same old hacks and they're desperately trying to get on telly, they wanna give us a call, we're not interested!
No.
No.
We've got bigger fish to fry.
Yeah, yeah.
Um, but yeah, so if - people that you hate. Um, minor celebrities.
Yeah.
People on TV, pop stars you don't like. Email in, ricky.gervais@xfm.co.uk. We're compiling a list.
And I'll tell you what, then we do like the - Channel 4 do, then we give you the sort of list of the top 10 at the end and you can vote within that top 10. I tell you ones that are in front though --
Could we - sorry, could we wire up some kind of premium rate phone line so that we make a fortune?
We can't afford it. But if when you email in, if you could also maybe um send us a lottery ticket.
Yeah.

Then, you know, we'll make something out of this. The ones in the lead, and I'm no - doing no particular order, but these are the ones way out in front at the moment. It's Chris Moyles, Robbie Williams, Chris Tarrant, Davina McCall.
Interesting.
I'm sort of surprised at that. But I know that it's probably just overpopularity.
I think she's just been on TV too much lately.
Yeah, that t-shirt annoys me, "Big Mother".
Sure.
That - that annoys me. Um, we don't care. We don't care whether you're pregnant or not. Loads of people have children. I don't care.
Yeah, get on with it.
And uh, Dominic Monaghan. So, uh, there's - the - they're - I mean, but, think of your own.
There's a lot of people just coming up behind there, though. Graham Norton.
Yeah.
He's just approaching from behind.
Graham Norton. Oh, there's the sort of stuff - it's sort of like we've done satire, we've done innuendo.
We've done smut.
I mean, he's - he's the king of the double entendre.
If anyone --
Well, he's the king of the single entendre but we can double it up if you want.
If anyone --
104.9, this is the sort of things we're available - go on!
If any --
I'm loving this, this is gonna be good! I'm loving what's coming next, what?
If any of the producers of Carry On London are listening and they need some new talent to write some smutty innuendo, I think we're your men.
Yeah. Um --
Anyway.
Karl, you better press the knob, right?
Oh!
To start the record, "Spunk".
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
The XFM listener hate list...some interesting results.
Go on then.
Reverse order.
Okay, in fifth place.
In fifth place: interesting, Davina McCall.
Yeah. I think that's just...I think that is reflective of her being on telly all the time and running out of stuff and being bit over-the-top and...yeah.
Fourth position.
Yeah.
Christopher Tarant.
Okay, well that's I mean, that's yeah, I wouldn't have thought he's the favourite role model of...go on.
There is a joint second place.
Go on.
Graham Norton...
Yeah.

...is alongside in second place...Patrick Kielty, which means Chris Moyles is the winner with an overwhelming vote and I swear to God, I have not done anything to those stats. That is exactly as they've come in off the email.
We do not give our opinions on this. That was the XFM listeners but err...well done.
Thumbs up, you all win a prize.
We're gonna play you some nice records because of that, aren't we?
Reckon they'd sort of prefer some ads.
Ehh, either's fine.
(Laughs) Yeah.

Feeder - Forget About Tomorrow, on XFM 104.9. When I was at University, my best mate was a bloke called Wally and he was doing psychology and I was doing philosophy and we both got into this thing, theory called determinism which about the state of the mind. It's a materialistic view that everything is part of the causal web and everything has a reaction for something that happened before and...by the way, Karl, do not confuse this with fatalism. Determinism is not predictive. It's just that if a brain state happens again, and...anyway.
Everyone knows.

Yeah. The famous one is if you know, a butterfly haven't shaken its wings Queen Victoria wouldn't have sneezed. Everything's indiscriminately linked, right. We're thinking that, right and we're thinking 'what if you changed one word in classic songs or one note in Beethoven's symphony?'.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
How it just wouldn't work.
Well I've always thought that 'come on baby light my fire'. Not as good. That sounds brilliant, enigmatic, interesting - not so good, more pedestrian if it was 'come on baby light a fire'.

(Laughs) Yeah. Yeah, just one thing wrong. That would be great, just sitting there...Paul McCartney comes to John and he goes 'Alright John? Written a song...She was just 17, well you know what I mean, the way she looked was way beyond compare. I wouldn't dance with another, (wails) OOOOOOOOOOOOOOHHH---.
I'll stop you there.
Go on.
I'll stop you there.
What's the matter?
Something not quite right with that...I love the song...
No? Yeah?
Once more...for us.
Well listen, don't be too harsh because we write our own songs, we can still put both our names to it.
Sure, I think you're a great talent, I think you're a great talent, I'm just saying...
Well listen, listen, listen you hippie, right?
Well, not yet.
Well not yet. But I mean - there's a Japanese bird outside looking in.
I don't fancy her, I'm not interested.
No, well listen, well.
And I'll never change my view.
(Laughs) Wait now listen, right? 'I wouldn't dance with another, (wails) OOOOOOHHH---
It's that bit.
Is it that bit you don't like?
That bit's not working. Could you try and just...is there a different pitch you could come in...
Well okay. 'I wouldn't dance with another, (wails) AAAAAAAHHH---
Again...
You don't like the...is it the noise?
I'm just not sure the girls are going to go crazy for it when we do that bit. Is there anything else you've got for us?
I love the idea of just changing one lyric. Radiohead. Well what's their classic song?
'Creep'.
'Creep'. You can't really change that, can you. 'Berk'. What if they called it...'oh, I'm a berk'.
Ha, ha, ha.
'I'm a twat'.
'I'm a knob'.
But don't worry about determinism, Karl.
Please.
Just cause it says we don't have a free will as such. You know, it's more an illusion. It's not whether we choose our choice, it's whether we can choose, you know, to choose our choices-
He knows all this.

But don't, but don't...as I say do not confuse it with fatalism. It is non predictive and does not change anything. I mean the moral upshots are frightening because if we have no free will then are we culpable for our actions. But again, it changes something because you've got to take people out of society that are a harm.
Karl has often said that.
Alright, Karl?
Am I still the president?
(Laughs) Yeah, go on. Yeah.
No, no, I'm just asking them that.
Yeah, what would you do? What you do about determinism? Change it.
I'd have a day off.
If you were president of America would you ban guns? It's in the constitution, everyone's allowed to have them.
Hmmmm. I don't know, I don't know. I'd have to think about it.
Sure.

(Laughs) I just love that, imagine all your different aides, and the secretary of state and generals coming to you, and they come out and they go 'What did he say?' He goes 'He said he's going to think about it.' 'Again, did he say that again, did he?' 'Yeah.' 'What was he doing?' 'He was on Ananova looking at monkey news. Apparently a chimp stole a car and drove to France.' Brilliant.
Ah, now, monkey news, you're talking.
I'll tell you what, shall we have a great song then monkey news?
It'll be an absolute treat.
What about a little bit of David Bowie, 'Sorrow'? Didn't write this one, but, I mean, he sings it bloody well.

David Bowie, 'Sorrow', on XFM 104.9. Nearly there, but you know, we're working our way up to the grand finale. The bit where Karl spouts absolute nonsense from a dodgy source on the internet about a monkey who did something impossible.
Let's cue up the jingle.
Hang on. Alright.
Perfect.
Ooh, chimpanzee that, monkey news, ya f...
Right, errr, let's have a look. This one's from some woman, right?
Yep.
And she was taking part in the London to Brighton bike ride, alright. Lovely day, weather's good and everything.
What year?

Just a couple of months ago. She's done all the training, alright, done all the training and stuff. Got a brand new bike for it, got a little puncture outfit and stuff all set for the day, right? So nice day, she sets off, they all start pedalling and that, on the way to Brighton, right? So she knows the route and that, got her little headphones on cycling along. Suddenly-

Right okay, I'm gonna stop you now. If a cyclist overtakes her, and it's going really fast and it's sort of hunched over but it's got like, lots of cycling gear on and a helmet and goggles and they can't tell what it is but they just know it's like a little hairy

Uhm fella, he hasn't bothered shaving his legs, which is weird isn't it 'cos cyclists usually shave their legs and this bloke had really hairy legs, but umm, and it won they gave it the medal, it won three years running, they gave us the key to the city and its own game show and then someone said "hold on though. This fellas are hunched over and he's only 3'5", and his arms are longer than his body. It's a chimp!" - if it goes anywhere near that we're never doing it again!
More monkey news next week.
Ricky laughs
So anyway, she's cycling cycling along, right, and this tricycle...
Ricky and steve laugh
I couldn't predict that!
There's always one element you can never anticipate.
Yeah! little kiddie's tricycle with a little kid on it. Little hairy kid with a helmet! Okay just... go on then.
The tricycle comes whizzing past.
WHIZZING past! yeah, strong legs aren't they, chimps.
So she's thinking "that's..." but didn't get a chance to see the face.
OHHH yeah. Couldn't quite see the cyclist! (laughing) Youuuu ohh God!
You bald mank git. Go on! Yeah research scientist Karl Pilkington.
So anyway, she gets to the end line, right, and they get talking and that. Said it was a nice day. Nice race and all that. Said "did you say a little... little thing on a tricycle?"
THING?! Well PERSON surely? Just a human. Did you see that? No. Did you see that bloke on the tricycle?
So anyway turns out...
But why'd she say thing? (inaudible) suspicious. I mean, what didn't she say "Did you see that fellow on a tricycle"?
Anyway, so he turns out...
Go on!
It was a chimp.
YOU ARE JOKING! Well christ-all-mighty. There you go, unbelievable and it was a chimp all along.
So anyways, right so the woman's like...
We're never doing this again!
Checking out the news. All right, there's nothing on it. She checks out Xfm Monkey News.
Right, ok I'm going to stop you there. If it turns out she looks on the news, right.
And the circus goes "we  looking for our chimp, it used to ride the tricycle, and it escaped with police chasing it".
No no no. So she listened to Xfm see if I'd picked up on the story.
Yeah. Sure.
I didn't have it and stuff. So she got in touch with the organizers of the London to Brighton bike ride and said "look, saw a little 'airy fella"
Why did she care!?
She wanted to know, she thought was a bit odd. Turned out it was a chimp. They weren't happy about.
Course not.
Because now the owner of the chimp wants to enter it into the Tour de France.
Ricky laughs
I'm gonna die! Oh go on.
Now a couple of questions. I trust you'll be able to answer these.
Go on.
Oh god! Steve help me out!
How did it get hold of the tricycle?
I don't know.
"I don't know"!
Okay, no that's fine. That's not the important point.
Like that's important, what's the matter with you steve?
How did it know to... well firstly how did it know which way to cycle, but more importantly how did you know there was a major bike ride?
Following the crowd, Steve. What's the matter with you?
The owner of it a trained it and stuff. It had already done the run beforehand, before the big day.
No it hadn't.
Like I said, it wants to do the Tour de France in 2005.
No it doesn't.
Erm...
But there's something about animal rights, if they don't let it enter. They can kick up a bit of a fuss.
(laughing) No! The animal rights is it's cruel to make a chimp ride a bicycle not that it's prejudice that it'd go "is it because I is hairy" you idiot!
Right.
Well, that is the worst. That is the WORST one yet. Absolute twaddle. Absolute rubbish karl.
Have you got a tricycle?
Unbelievable.
